alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Hancock (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:40PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Claiborne and Hancock Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Tazewell, or 13 miles west of Sneedville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sneedville, Tazewell, Howard Quarter and Evanston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
